title: While writing the UPSC Mains answer, should the answer be written in introduction-body-conclusion format or should it be answered to the point without any introduction? - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: Not only in UPSC but in other competitive exams of descriptive nature as well, the introduction needs to be strictly dispensed. Your first line is the indicator to the examiner where do you stand as a competitor among many others whose answer books he has been checking. So first line should be the best. It should squeeze all the background in erudite and lucid manner so that everthing is clear. My suggestion is to begin with the central theme of the question and elaborate its related aspects in subsequent paragraphs. Remember , reading first few lines the examiner will decide a set point as to which bracket of the score your answer falls. It will determine his psychological make up. All the good writing is nothing but to carry the reader along in an interesting conversation.

Actually, Introduction is the precursor to the actual content of the answer. As it is said, “ first impression is the last impression”, writing an impressive introduction is the 1st opportunity to impress examiner. Body : The Actual Content of the answer. Conclusion : An imp. Component of the answer, as it leaves the final impression in the mind of the examiner. So, If you want to score good marks, you've to impress your examiner with your content.
